FuncDef: The reset isis error command clears information about incorrect LSPs and Hello packets.

ParaDef.Info:
Clears the incorrect LSPs and Hello packets of an IS-IS process.
By default, information about incorrect LSPs and Hello packets received by all processes is cleared.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Clears the incorrect LSPs and Hello packets of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Clears the incorrect LSPs and Hello packets of an interface.
-

Clears the incorrect LSPs and Hello packets of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When troubleshooting IS-IS network faults, you can run the reset isis error command to clear the existing statistics before checking new information about incorrect LSPs and Hello packets.
